conclusion: Determine the equivalent resistance of the circuit and calculate the maximum power consumed by the external resistor using the magnetic induction variation.

The image shows a circular coil with a magnetic field applied perpendicular to its plane, connected in series with an external resistor. A graph of magnetic induction (B) over time (t) is provided, showing a linear increase.
The coil has a resistance of r = 10 Ω and is connected in series with an external resistor R = 50 Ω.
The equivalent resistance of the circuit is R_eq = r + R = 10 Ω + 50 Ω = 60 Ω.
The maximum power consumed by the external resistor occurs when the current through the circuit is at its maximum.
The graph shows magnetic induction B increasing linearly with time, reaching a maximum value at t = 4 seconds.
The maximum current I_max occurs at t = 4 seconds and can be calculated using the maximum magnetic induction B_max.
The maximum power P_max consumed by the external resistor is given by P_max = I_max^2 × R.
Using the given area S = 1 m^2 and the number of turns N = 200, the maximum power can be calculated.
The maximum power is P_max = 0.2 × 60 = 12 watts.
